## ManipulationNode interface

It's an interface to provide APIs which manipulate a node for developers. There are some event emitters. one of them emits events when detecting changes in child nodes. It can be a contract for developers to build treex.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface ManipulationNode<T> extends ViewNode<T> 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [ViewNode](./treex.viewnode.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [appendAfter(node)](./treex.manipulationnode.appendafter.md) | It usually append a node successfully, but it isn't possible to append a node next to root node. |
|  [appendBefore(node)](./treex.manipulationnode.appendbefore.md) | It usually append a node successfully, but it isn't possible to append a node in front of root node. |
|  [appendChild(node)](./treex.manipulationnode.appendchild.md) |  |
|  [onChildChanged()](./treex.manipulationnode.onchildchanged.md) |  |
|  [onRemoved()](./treex.manipulationnode.onremoved.md) | When a node is removed in a tree it belongs to, it resolve a promise. |
|  [remove()](./treex.manipulationnode.remove.md) | Remove itself in a tree it belong to. |
|  [removeAllChildren()](./treex.manipulationnode.removeallchildren.md) | Clean up a child list. |
|  [removeChild(node)](./treex.manipulationnode.removechild.md) | Remove a child node. |
